required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessing Diabetes Mellitus on Cytokine Analysis and Macular Edema Following FLACS
clinical_study.official_title: Assessing the Impact of Diabetes Mellitus on Anterior Chamber Cytokine Production and Postoperative Macular Edema in Patients Undergoing Femtosecond Laser-assisted Cataract Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the effects of diabetes mellitus (DM) on anterior chamber cytokine production and postoperative macular edema in patients undergoing femtosecond laser-assisted cataract surgery (FLACS). Patients with DM routinely undergo FLACS, yet the majority of studies evaluating intraocular inflammation following femtosecond laser treatment have excluded this patient population. Importantly, DM alters the inflammatory status of the eye, which may influence the production of inflammatory mediators following femtosecond laser treatment and the development of postoperative macular edema. The results from this study will provide insight into the risks and benefits of FLACS in patients with DM.

primary_outcome.measure: Aqueous humor concentrations of inflammatory mediators at the onset of manual cataract surgery and following femtosecond laser treatment
primary_outcome.description: Cytokine concentration at time of cataract surgery

secondary_outcome.measure: Prevalence of postoperative macular edema in control and diabetic participants
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Post op day 1, week 1, month 1 and month 3

secondary_outcome.measure: Postoperative change in central retinal thickness
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Post op day 1, week 1, month 1 and month 3
Post op day 1, week 1, month 1 and month 3

secondary_outcome.measure: Microvascular changes and development of cystic macular lesions
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Post op day 1, week 1, month 1 and month 3
secondary_outcome.description: Slit lamp exam of microvascular changes and development of cystic macular lesions

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Post op day 1, week 1, month 1 and month 3

secondary_outcome.measure: Prevalence and severity of postoperative flare
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Post op day 1, week 1, month 1 and month 3
secondary_outcome.description: Slit lamp exam for prevalence and severity of postoperative flare

arm_group.arm_group_label: Control patients undergoing manual cataract surgery
Diabetic patients undergoing manual cataract surgery

intervention.description: Cataract surgery- Manual or femtosecond laser assisted
intervention.arm_group_label: Control patients undergoing manual cataract surgery
Diabetic patients undergoing manual cataract surgery

study_pop.textblock: Patients enrolling for Cataract surgery at Uptown Eye Specialists

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All patients who are scheduled for manual cataract surgery or FLACS who have provided informed consent, in accordance with application regulations and guidelines.
- Only one eye from each participant will be included in the study (the first one to be operated on).
Exclusion Criteria:
- Intravitreal anti-VEGF injection < 3 months prior to cataract surgery
- Laser photocoagulation < 3 months prior to cataract surgery
- Complications during manual cataract surgery or FLACS
- Current or previous ocular or systemic inflammation
- History of rheumatic or immune disease
- Poor pharmacologic mydriasis
- Corneal opacities
- Pseudoexfoliation syndrome
- Previous ocular surgery or trauma
- Use of topical or systemic steroids < 6 months prior to surgery
- Prostaglandin analog eyedrop therapy
- Glaucoma
- Age-related macular degeneration
